text: Marion Tournon-Branly (23 September 1924 - 15 May 2016)Disparition de Marion Tournon Branly was a French architect. She was born in Paris. His father was architect Paul Tournon and mother was painter Élisabeth Branly. She studied at the École nationale supérieure des Beaux-Arts. She worked with her father and Auguste Perret. She designed villas, elementary schools, buildings for the Fleury Abbey and the modern church of the Fontenelle Abbey.Le Don de l'architecture. Paul Tournon, Marion Tournon-Branly, French National Archives, Fontainebleau, 2013 (exhibition booklet) Tournon-Branly died in Paris on 15 May 2016, aged 91. == References == ==Other websites== Category:1924 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Architects from Paris
title: Marion Tournon-Branly
